title: running spack "compilers" for debugging
body:
So get this failure: 

```
Executing: /Users/barrysmith/Src/spack/opt/spack/darwin-sierra-x86_64/clang-8.0.0-apple/mpich-3.2-l5mtvmaqleehu4w6igdxmabcs6u5gew5/bin/mpicc  -o /var/folders/c1/ldz_dt8n2r3dtwv_chp5pfr40000gn/T/petsc-XZc9cS/config.setCompilers/conftest    /var/folders/c1/ldz_dt8n2r3dtwv_chp5pfr40000gn/T/petsc-XZc9cS/config.setCompilers/conftest.o 
Possible ERROR while running linker: exit code 256
stderr:
Undefined symbols for architecture x86_64:
  "_ADIOI_Datarep_head", referenced from:
      import-atom in libpmpi.dylib
  "_ADIOI_Datatype_iscontig", referenced from:
      import-atom in libpmpi.dylib
```

to debug it I want to run the compiler directly myself to see what is happening.  So I try

```
$ /Users/barrysmith/Src/spack/opt/spack/darwin-sierra-x86_64/clang-8.0.0-apple/mpich-3.2-l5mtvmaqleehu4w6igdxmabcs6u5gew5/bin/mpicc --show
Spack compiler must be run from Spack! Input 'SPACK_PREFIX' is missing.
~/Src/spack/bin (barry/develop>) 
```

So given a speck-build.env how can I set up the environment so I can run the compiler to debug failures?
